topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5572744a636872046dd10800#post_5572744a636872046dd10800

I, Robot (The book! Not the film loosely based on it) treated those themes more realistically for western values.

Yes, maybe Chobits gave a good preview as to how an Asian culture would view robotics and their role in daily life, but I doubt it would be the same for westerns, even after they become a common thing.

That, and it's too romanticized for my taste.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557273376368727cba880c00#post_557273376368727cba880c00
it's just been such an eventful 4 years, i mean my whole life has changed

so many experiences, so many memories, so many changes

it's fuckin nuts when i think back to back then and i'm like "yeah man, def leppard, ponyspin, a can of soda, and ponychan are all i need"

things were so much better and simpler back then, and i'm too nostalgic for my own good

topics.body: Four chapters and Shiori Experience is quickly becoming a favorite of mine. The artwork just pops and you can tell that writer Machida Kazuya has a deep love for 70's and 80's era rock.
